page.title: 01Local History of Nailsea
page.content: {Nailsea}is a fast-growing town. The {population}in{1985}is approximately 15 000 people. The Town is situated about 16 kilometres south-west of Bristol and 24 kilometres north-east of Weston-super-Mare. Originally, Nailsea was just a cluster of small hamlets joined by winding country lanes. The main reason for the sudden growth of Nailsea into a town during the 18th and 19th centuries was the discovery of{coal}at comparatively shallow depths and, later, the setting up of the{glass-works}near the source of fuel,the coal-mines. Today nothing is left of the coal-mines except for some ruins of mine-shafts.The glass-works have disappeared too but a site just south of the High Street is being excavated to reveal the base of one of the old glass-works cones.
